snippet: A decade of American investment in Afghanistan still shows too few measures of success.
abstract: Editorial cites some problems cataloged by John Sopko, special inspector general on Afghan reconstruction, noting Sopko's conclusion that some reconstruction programs actually work against American interests; urges Congress to demand answers from Obama administration to questions raised by Sopko's reports before it approves additional financing for Afghan reconstruction efforts.
lead_paragraph: A decade of American investment in Afghanistan still shows too few measures of success.
